name: Access Control - User Registration and Provisioning
description: Access to system components requires documented access request and approval from authorized personnel prior to provisioning. User accounts are created, enabled, modified, disabled, and removed in accordance with organizational access control policies and procedures.
objective: Ensure that access to organizational systems and data is granted only to authorized individuals following proper request and approval procedures, and that accounts are managed throughout their lifecycle.
control_activities: Access requests are submitted through formal request process
Requests are reviewed and approved by appropriate management
User accounts are provisioned based on approved requests
Account creation follows principle of least privilege
Access is reviewed periodically for appropriateness
Accounts are disabled or removed upon termination or role change
key_attributes: Formal access request and approval process
Segregation of duties between requestors and approvers
evidence_requirements: System access logs showing account creation
User access matrices or role definitions
testing_procedures: Review sample of access requests for proper approval
Verify account creation follows approved requests
Test segregation of duties in access provisioning
Verify termination procedures disable access timely
